page.title: 16THROCKLEY FIRST SCHOOL.
page.content: Throckley First School was opened in{1972}and was a purpose-built open-plan school. In{1974}when boundry changes came into force the school became part of Newcastle upon Tyne area instead of Northumberland. It is situated a short distance south of the main West Road from Newcastle to Carlisle and the{"vallum" which dates from Roman times gives the name to one of the school buildings. Most of the children enjoy living in Throckley and appreciate the nearby facilities and the open spaces which enable them to play out of doors. Many people take great care of their gardens and in 1985 the school and the area have made a every effort to make Throckley a worthy contestant for{"Britain in Bloom".
